result.execSummary:
The defendant Natalie P Quartullo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Pay county appointed attorney fees. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.   rmm
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP case.

Defendant Natalie P Quartullo in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Pay county appointed attorney fees.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

State informed the Court the victim would like the no contact order modified to a no violent contact order.  Pursuant to the restraining order, Court ordered the no contact order be modified to a No Violent Contact Order.  Defendant may not have any contact with the victim at his residence or the residence itself.

Defendant Natalie P Quartullo in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Defense is going to appeal the DPA decision and would like an adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Natalie P Quartullo in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for Status Conference. Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 04/15/15 to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 07/01/15.

Defendant Natalie P Quartullo in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Natalie P Quartullo in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Mayaan Silver as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Silver accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 7/01/15 until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

15RM017070  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-02-15

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Christopher M

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Natalie P Quartullo in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Natalie P Quartullo in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Br. 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
